page.title: 01INTRODUCTION 03800597
page.content: { Rochester}probably derives its name from the presence of the{Roman station of Bremenium,the remains of which lie half a mile North of the village. Its military associations remain as the Ministry of Defence has built Redesdale Army camp just West of the village. {Rochester is situated 37 miles from {Newcastle upon Tyne and 10 miles from {the Border on the busy A68}trunk road.This is one of the main routes into Scotland and a large volume of traffic passes through, including tourist cars,long_distance buses, transport vehicles and a number of army vehicles en route to the camp and firing range. The whole of the area lies within the{National Park}and is one of rugged natural beauty preserved by the farming community.Tourists passing through often stop again.
